example.text: In less than a month, this year has become one defined by shock and sorrow. The American gun violence epidemic is a policy choice.

Black women and girls are the missing piece to securing our Nation's future, and I hope that every single one of my colleagues, Democrat and Republican alike, support the Black Women Best resolution. Every action we take towards bettering the quality of life for Black women and girls everywhere is a step in the right direction.

Instead of raising taxes on workers to help the wealthy, Democrats did the opposite. The Inflation Reduction Act brings down key costs for hard-working Americans without raising taxes on small businesses or families whose household income totals $400,000 or less.
Republicans in Washington want to stick it to working people to bear the burden of terrible cuts, instead of making billionaires and big corporations pay their fair share in taxes. [[url]]

200 mass shootings. I mourn the victims of the hateful act of violence in Texas. My heart breaks for all 200 communities that are mourning this year. We must do something. American lives depend on it.

The added benefit that it will help save the lives of our nation's bravest makes this a no-brainer. National Defense Authorization Act On July 14th, the House of Representatives voted to pass the National Defense Authorization Act along unusually partisan lines.
It's time we chose better. I spoke on the House floor about the urgent need for gun violence prevention legislation: I refuse to normalize tragedy.
